1ã€What can the PYTH token be used for?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šStaking to secure data and voting in governance

2ã€What problem does Pyth Network aim to solve?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šLimited and expensive access to high-quality market data

3ã€Who contributes data to Pyth Network?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šTrading firms, banks, exchanges, and market makers

4ã€What is Pyth's long-term vision?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šTo make the worldâ€™s most valuable prices accessible to everyone, not just a few institutions

5ã€What are some governance decisions made by the Pyth DAO?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šDeciding on onchain and offchain fees, asset coverage, and staking mechanisms

6ã€What future model is Pyth exploring for institutional adoption?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šA subscription service for getting real-time financial data like Bloomberg

7ã€What is Oracle Integrity Staking(OIS)?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šA system where publishers and community members stake PYTH tokens to back data accuracy

8ã€On how many blockchains is Pyth data available?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šOver 100

9ã€How many real-time price feeds does Pyth currently offer?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šOver 2,000

10. What unique feature does each Pyth price feed include?
ç­”æ¡ˆï¼šConfidence intervals showing volatility and certainty levels

item.title: The new king of Perp on the chain emerges â€” Extended After betting on hyperliquid and edgex, I have been looking for the most ideal perp competitor i...
item.description:
The new king of Perp on the chain emerges â€” Extended

After betting on hyperliquid and edgex, I have been looking for the most ideal perp competitor in my mind as my next key bet project. Thank God, I found Extended

Why am I so optimistic about Extended?

When I first experienced Extended, I felt a sense of familiarity. Yes, it was Hyperliquid. Extended perfectly inherited the high-quality user experience of Hyperliquid.

I even think its experience surpasses lighter and edgex, just like hyperliquid, and the Extended experience is no different from CEX.

Itâ€™s a simple truth that only good product experience can attract real traders, rather than relying on the expectation of airdrop rewards to attract fake transactions. This is a problem that PERP products on the chain must face.

Letâ€™s talk about the background of Extendedâ€™s team. The core team members are all from Revolutâ€™s crypto department. Revolut is a top global financial technology giant with more than 60 million users, $4 billion in annual revenue and a valuation of $75 billion.

The entire Extended engineering team has experience in traditional financial matching engines and high-frequency trading, which is crucial for the development of on-chain PERP products.

From the perspective of a public blockchain:

Extended is the top-ranked perp product on the Starknet blockchain. StarkWare also led Extended's seed round. Starknet will support Extended as a core ecosystem project. Extended is already the second-ranked protocol on the Starknet blockchain, and it can be said that Extended will be Starknet's flagship product.

Regarding airdrop rewards:

A 30% TGE allocation has been confirmed, with TGE expected to be distributed in the first half of next year.

If you are a firm believer in perp dex, welcome to join extended

Below is my extended invitation link. Use my link to enjoy 10% fee reduction and extra 10% points bonus.

https://app.extended.exchange/join/PANG

Thanks to the Extended team for creating a great perp dex for us
@extendedapp @rf_extended @dk_extended @spooky_x10 @lttlanna

item.title: RT Tibor Blaho: OpenAI DevDay 2025: Opening Keynote with Sam Altman - OpenAI grew from 2 million weekly developers and 100 million weekly ChatGPT user...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Tibor Blaho
OpenAI DevDay 2025: Opening Keynote with Sam Altman

- OpenAI grew from 2 million weekly developers and 100 million weekly ChatGPT users in 2023 to 4 million developers and 800M+ weekly ChatGPT users in 2025

- The platform now processes over 6 billion tokens per minute on the API, up from 300 million tokens per minute in 2023

Apps inside ChatGPT

- OpenAI launched the Apps SDK in preview, built on Model Context Protocol, enabling developers to build real apps inside ChatGPT that are interactive, adaptive, and personalized

- Launch partners include Booking, Canva, Coursera, Expedia, Figma, Spotify, and Zillow, with apps available today to all logged-in ChatGPT users outside of the EU on Free, Go, Plus and Pro plans

- OpenAI will support many ways to monetize including the new Agentic Commerce Protocol that offers instant checkout right inside ChatGPT

- Later this year, OpenAI will begin accepting app submissions for review and publication, launch a dedicated directory where users can browse and search for apps, and launch apps to ChatGPT Business, Enterprise and Edu (OpenAI expects to bring apps to EU users soon)

Building agents

- AgentKit includes Agent Builder (visual canvas for creating multi-agent workflows with drag-and-drop nodes, available in beta), ChatKit (toolkit for embedding customizable chat-based agent experiences, generally available starting today), and expanded Evals capabilities (datasets, trace grading, automated prompt optimization, third-party model support, generally available starting today)

- Connector Registry (beginning beta rollout to some API, ChatGPT Enterprise and Edu customers with a Global Admin Console) consolidates data sources into a single admin panel across ChatGPT and the API, including pre-built connectors like Dropbox, Google Drive, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, and third-party MCP servers

- Guardrails is an open-source, modular safety layer that helps protect agents against unintended or malicious behavior, available to mask or flag PII, detect jailbreaks, and apply other safeguards

Writing [code]

- Codex is officially out of research preview and into general availability with new Slack integration, Codex SDK, and admin tools including environment controls, monitoring, and analytics dashboards

- Daily usage of Codex has grown by more than 10x since early August, with GPT-5-Codex serving over 40 trillion tokens in the three weeks since launch

- Nearly all OpenAI engineers use Codex today (up from just over half in July), merging 70% more pull requests each week, with Codex automatically reviewing almost every PR

- Starting October 20, Codex cloud tasks will begin counting towards usage limits (Plus: 30-150 local messages or 5-40 cloud tasks every 5 hours, Pro: 300-1,500 local messages or 50-400 cloud tasks every 5 hours, with code review not counting toward limits for a limited time)

API updates

- gpt-5-pro (gpt-5-pro-2025-10-06) is now available in the API ($15 per 1M input tokens, $120 per 1M output tokens) for tasks in domains like finance, legal, and healthcare where you need high accuracy and depth of reasoning

- gpt-realtime-mini (gpt-realtime-mini-2025-10-06 - $0.60 per 1M text input tokens, $2.40 per 1M text output tokens, $10 per 1M audio input tokens, $20 per 1M audio output tokens) is 70% cheaper than the advanced voice model with the same voice quality and expressiveness

- gpt-audio-mini (gpt-audio-mini-2025-10-06 - $0.60 per 1M text input tokens, $2.40 per 1M text output tokens, $10 per 1M audio input tokens, $20 per 1M audio output tokens) provides cost-efficient audio processing

- sora-2 ($0.10 per second for 720x1280 or 1280x720) and sora-2-pro ($0.30 per second for 720x1280 or 1280x720, $0.50 per second for 1024x1792 or 1792x1024) are available in preview in the API with the ability to pair sound with visuals including rich soundscapes, ambient audio, and synchronized effects, plus control over video length, aspect ratio, resolution, and the ability to easily remix videos

- gpt-image-1-mini ($2 per 1M text input tokens, $2.50 per 1M image input tokens, $8 per 1M image output tokens, $0.005-$0.015 per image depending on quality and size) is 80% less expensive than the large model


Tibor Blaho:â€‚OpenAI livestream "OpenAI DevDay 2025: Opening Keynote with Sam Altman"

"Sam Altman kicks off DevDay 2025 with a keynote to explore ideas that will challenge how you think about building. Join us for announcements, live demos, and a vision of how developers are reshaping the

item.title: RT Wrecks: Re Hey, Wals - Ryan, CMO of @solsticefi here. Wanted to fill in some gaps for you and the rest of the community here. Solstice is not relat...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Wrecks
Re Hey, Wals - Ryan, CMO of @solsticefi here. Wanted to fill in some gaps for you and the rest of the community here.

Solstice is not related to the business of XR, and as anyone can quickly verify, Ben and all other co-founders of Solstice were not in any way part of the team at XR.

This FUD appears to be coming from individuals who were a part of the community during XRâ€™s failed launch. A few quick facts to let you know why people are saying these things:
- XR was building a web3 gaming infrastructure project. Web3 gaming as a vertical has seen a lot of projects shut down over the last 6-12 months.
- Two team members who were a part of the failed XR launch and have since joined Solstice.
- Ben and all co-founders of solstice were never a part of the XR team.

We're committed to full transparency, both off and onchain. All Solstice metrics, security, and protocol resilience can be verified on chain at each step of our journey.

We're happy everyone is doing their due diligence before investing funds, this is a great step. And we're excited to continue to prove to you why we think Solstice is the place to do just that.

RTâ€‚Cody_DeFi
å®åœ¨å¤ªç¦»è°±äº†ï¼Œ @nemoprotocol è¢«ç›—ä¹‹åï¼Œä¸ºäº†å®‰å…¨é‡æ–°å†™äº†ä¸€éåè®®ä»£ç ï¼Œç„¶åæäº¤å®¡æŸ¥ï¼Œç„¶åå³ä½¿æ²¡è¢«ç›—çš„èµ„äº§ï¼Œä¹Ÿè¢«æš‚æ—¶æ€§çš„å†»ç»“åœ¨é‡Œé¢äº†ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æœ‰å¤§é‡ç”¨æˆ·çš„èµ„äº§è¿˜æ²‰æ·€åœ¨ @MMTFinance å’Œ @nemoprotocol çš„æ± å­ä¸­ã€‚

å½“åˆå¾ˆå¤šç”¨æˆ·æ˜¯å†²ç€ @MMTFinance çš„ç§¯åˆ†ï¼Œæ‰å»å‚ä¸çš„ NEMO çš„åè®®ï¼Œç»“æœ NEMO å‡ºäº‹ä¹‹åï¼ŒMMT ç›´æ¥æŠŠæ‰€æœ‰é€šè¿‡ NEMO å­˜é’±çš„ç”¨æˆ·ç§¯åˆ†éƒ½æŠ¹æ¶ˆæ‰äº†ã€‚

å®åœ¨æ— æ³•ç†è§£ï¼Œä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆ MMT è¦è¿™ä¹ˆåšï¼Œä½œä¸ºå…³è”ç”Ÿæ€åè®®ï¼Œåœ¨ç”Ÿæ€åè®®å‡ºé—®é¢˜çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œä¸ä»…ä¸ç»™äºˆæ´æ‰‹ï¼Œç”šè‡³è¿˜æŠŠç”¨æˆ·çš„å†å²ç§¯åˆ†éƒ½æŠ¹æ¶ˆæ‰äº†ï¼Œæ™®é€šç”¨æˆ·ä¸ä»…æŸå¤±äº†é’±ï¼Œè¿˜æŸå¤±äº†æœºä¼šæˆæœ¬ï¼ŒDEFI ç”¨æˆ·ä¹Ÿå®åœ¨å¤ªå¼±åŠ¿äº†å§ï¼Ÿ

MMT çš„åˆ›å§‹äºº @ChefMMT_X å¯æ˜¯å£å£å£°å£°è¯´

â€œTotally. We all build on Sui ecosystem and we believe we stay stronger together.â€

ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè½¬å¤´å°±æŠŠ NEMO çš„ç”¨æˆ·æŠ›å¼ƒäº†ï¼Œè¿™æ ·å­ä»¥åè¿˜æ€ä¹ˆèƒ½å¤Ÿè®©äººä¿¡ä»»å’Œå‚ä¸ SUI é“¾çš„ DEFI åè®®ï¼Ÿé¡¹ç›®æ–¹èƒ½ä¸èƒ½è€ƒè™‘ä¸€ä¸‹ç”¨æˆ·çš„æ„Ÿå—ï¼Ÿ @NemoEugene

â€”â€”

This is just outrageous. After @nemoprotocol was hacked, they rewrote the entire protocol code for security reasons and submitted it for review. But even the assets that werenâ€™t stolen ended up temporarily frozen. As a result, a large number of user funds are still locked in the pools of @MMTFinance and @nemoprotocol.

Back then, many users participated in the NEMO protocol mainly for the points offered by @MMTFinance. But after the NEMO incident, MMT directly erased all the points earned by users who deposited through NEMO.

Itâ€™s truly incomprehensible why MMT would do this. As an interconnected project in the same ecosystem, not only did they fail to offer any support when a fellow project encountered problems, but they even erased usersâ€™ historical points. Regular users didnâ€™t just lose moneyâ€”they also lost opportunity costs. Are DeFi users really this powerless?

The founder of MMT, @ChefMMT_X, once said:

â€œTotally. We all build on Sui ecosystem and we believe we stay stronger together.â€

item.title: RT Hyper Foundation: Hypurr NFTs have been deployed on the HyperEVM. Participants had the opportunity to opt in to receive a Hypurr NFT after the Hype...
item.description:
RTâ€‚Hyper Foundation
Hypurr NFTs have been deployed on the HyperEVM.

Participants had the opportunity to opt in to receive a Hypurr NFT after the HyperEVM went live as part of the Genesis Event in November 2024. The HyperEVM launched in February 2025 as the general programmability interface to the Hyperliquid L1. The HyperEVM is not a standalone EVM. Rather, it allows developers to trustlessly tap into the liquidity on HyperCore. Read precompiles allow smart contracts on the HyperEVM to read L1 state, and the CoreWriter contract allows HyperEVM smart contracts to send actions on HyperCore. This two-way communication between Core and EVM secured by the same HyperBFT consensus protocol unlocks powerful new primitives. Many novel applications have been built on the HyperEVM exploring these possibilities, including LSTs, lending, and vault tokenization protocols.

The goal of the Hypurr NFT collection was to share a memento with those who believed in and contributed early on to Hyperliquidâ€™s growth. Each NFT is unique and captures the different moods, hobbies, tastes, and quirks of the Hyperliquid community, as depicted by Hypurr.

There are a total of 4,600 NFTs in the collection. 4,313 NFTs went to Genesis Event participants, 144 went to the Hyper Foundation, and 143 went to core contributors, including Hyperliquid Labs, NFT artists, and other contributors.

Ownership and use of Hypurr NFTs are subject to the Hypurr NFT Terms and License available here: https://hyperfoundation.org/nftTerms. Participants who opted in to receive a Hypurr NFT as part of the Genesis Event were screened according to the Foundation's risk-based program. In addition, clustering analysis was conducted to protect against sybil behavior and cap the total number of NFTs received by any given user.

Contract address: 0x9125E2d6827a00B0F8330D6ef7BEF07730Bac685.

To be clear: No action is required. You do not need to mint. The NFT collection has already been distributed. As always, beware of scams and impersonations.

item.title: ã€ŠWhat are the most influential people in crypto thinking right now? 2/3ã€‹ Continuing from yesterdayâ€™s threadâ€” âœ… CZ believes that in the future, th...
item.description:
ã€ŠWhat are the most influential people in crypto thinking right now? 2/3ã€‹

Continuing from yesterdayâ€™s threadâ€”

âœ… CZ believes that in the future, the market for decentralized exchanges (DEXs) will be far larger than that of centralized exchanges (CEXs). He sees CEXs as merely the stepping stone for Web2 users entering the crypto world, since they resemble the familiar banking system. But once people gain more experience, theyâ€™ll set sail into the freer world of DEXs.

â€” Thatâ€™s why he thinks the real future lies in chains, which is even forcing him to spend more time on BNB Chain rather than Binance CEX! (No wonder BNB Chainâ€™s progress feels nuclear-powered right now, and no wonder Aster has been going crazy.)

In the future, thereâ€™s no doubt that more developers will choose to build on BNB Chain. With CZ personally steering the ship, receiving his attention and mentions provides far more leverage for project growth than on other chains.

âœ… CZ also believes that in the future, there wonâ€™t be such clear dividing lines between finance sectors â€” no more â€œtraditional finance,â€ â€œWeb2,â€ or â€œWeb3.â€ Instead, there will just be finance, differentiated by the technologies being used.

Crypto companies will fully merge with traditional financial markets.

âœ… He also praised the DAT (Digital Asset Treasury) trend pioneered by Michael Saylor. He admires that someone with the experience, capability, and belief in Bitcoin from the traditional corporate world could step up, innovate, and drive the industry forward. Very impressive.

DAT, whether directly or indirectly, can help the crypto ecosystem grow. That makes it a win-win.

To be continuedâ€¦

you can find the video right here:
https:// http://youtube.com/watch?v=JZz1IRkLcbw

Thanks @namdar and @cz_binance provide this conversation.
